meanings.definition: Superlative form of the adjective 'sonsy', meaning healthy and strong.
meanings.sent1: The lion looked the sonsiest in the whole jungle.
meanings.sent2: She felt her sonsiest after a good night's sleep.
meanings.sent3: The tree with the sonsiest leaves seemed to shine in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Among all the flowers, the rose stood out as the sonsiest.
meanings.sent5: The champion athlete was the sonsiest of them all, winning every race.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of the adverb 'sonsy', meaning in a healthy and strong manner.
meanings.sent1: He ran the sonsiest during the marathon, finishing first.
meanings.sent2: She sang the sonsiest at the concert, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent3: The chef cooked the sonsiest, creating a delicious meal for everyone.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed sonsiest after the heavy rain, rushing downstream.
meanings.sent5: The team played sonsiest, scoring goal after goal in the match.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of the noun 'sonsy', meaning a healthy and strong person.
meanings.sent1: He was known as the sonsiest warrior in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: She proved to be the sonsiest in the group, lifting the heaviest weights.
meanings.sent3: The dog was the sonsiest in the park, fetching the ball with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: The oak tree stood sonsiest among all the trees in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The doctor was the sonsiest in the hospital, always ready to help patients.
